definition.title: What is Carpal Tunnel Syndrome?
definition.content: Carpal tunnel syndrome is a condition that causes pain, numbness, and weakness in the hand and fingers due to the compression of the median nerve at the wrist. It can be treated with conservative therapies, like medication and splinting, but sometimes more advanced treatment options, such as minimally invasive surgery, may be required.

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Treatment options for carpal tunnel syndrome vary depending on the severity of the condition. In some cases, conservative therapies such as medication, splinting, and lifestyle modifications may be recommended. However, in more severe cases, carpal tunnel surgery may be the best option.
